definition: to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]
limit up, limit down/limit on daily price variation

sentences.english: Markets see-sawed all day, with S&P officials refusing to comment on their plans.
sentences.chinese: 市場全天反覆漲跌，標普高管拒絕就其計劃置評。

sentences.english: Markets go up, and markets go down.
The stock markets have become extremely volatile.
sentences.chinese: 股票市場已經變得極端的漲跌無常。

sentences.english: Accordingly, it is argued that current price limits in China should be relaxed or exterminated.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我國應取消或放寬當前的漲跌幅限制。

sentences.english: Stop stressing about the day to day ups and downs of your investments.
sentences.chinese: 不要每天爲自己金融資產的漲漲跌跌而緊張。

sentences.english: Asian shares were mixed while U. S. stock futures were pointing to mild gains on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 亞洲股市漲跌互現，美國股指期貨開盤後小幅走高。

sentences.english: In power card market, subscriber power card rise and drop half-and-half , but the oscillation amplitude squeezes obviously.
sentences.chinese: 權證市場上，認購權證漲跌參半，但振幅明顯收窄。

sentences.english: It's up to the individual investor to find out why.
sentences.chinese: 而投資者要自己發現爲什麼會發生這樣的漲跌。

sentences.english: High techs are mixed and Intel is unchanged.
sentences.chinese: 高科技類股漲跌互見，英特爾股價持平。

sentences.english: The dollar was mixed and gold rose.
sentences.chinese: 美元對主要貨幣互有漲跌，黃金價格上漲。

sentences.english: US stock marketing that is remixed in Tuesday's early trading.
sentences.chinese: 美國股票市場指數在週二早些時候的交易中漲跌互見。

sentences.english: Even rumors of his trades can send the market up or down.
sentences.chinese: 甚至是有關他的交易傳言也可以推動股市漲跌。
美國國外，歐洲市場漲跌互現。

sentences.english: At the most fundamental level, the market is simply a series of up and down tics that form patterns.
sentences.chinese: 從最基本的角度來看，市場的漲漲跌跌形成模式。

sentences.english: Real-time stock price updates, Change the situation.
sentences.chinese: 即時查詢最新股票價格，漲跌情況。
大宗商品價格漲跌互現。

definition: (of a stock price or market index) currently higher than at the previous day's close
bull market (prices appear to be rising)
to lose what one has just obtained (idiom)
